element.name: Roped In by Kersti.com, Multi-cache (2.5/1.5)

long-description.br:
"The Linesman" is a life-like bronze of a docks worker, it reminds us that this area used to be a busy shipping area. Nearby is a memorial to Matt Talbot the temperance campaigner and another to merchant seamen who lost their lives during the "Emergency".
The Cache:
At the coordinates given is a feature. You need to find a few numbers in order to discover the location of the cache.
What day in the month was this feature unveiled? Call this AB.
How many letters are in the surname of the person who unveiled it? Call this C.
How many buttons are on the shirt? Call this D.
How many horizontal railing surround the feature? Call this E.
The first digit of the year it was unveiled is F.
Now to find the final location, solve below with each square bracket denoting one digit:
N 53° [F][Bx8].[F^E][C-A-(DxF)][Bx5]
W 006° [A][C-D].[C+A][D+F+E][Ax3+B]

element.additional-waypoints:
HIDDEN: FL19CG0 - Final location
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
About 400 meters south east of starting point
element.encoded-hints: Behind the stone, at ground level.

ul.li:
2010-06-09T19:00:00Z : Found it by Die-3-Fragezeichen
This cache especially jumped into my eye because the female part of our team is named as the owner!? When I hear linesman usually the now called ref assistant comes in my mind. Nice feature, TFTC and greetings from Germany, 3???

2010-06-08T07:55:02Z : Found it by hollmanr
Found on slight detour on route to work this morning. Busy spot. SL. TFTC

2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by eve1987
Very hard work to find the box, because it had fallen on the ground. But we made it ;)
Very interesting sculpture!
TFTC and kind regards from Austria, eve

2010-06-01T19:00:00Z : Found it by GudrunXY
A quick find with eve1987 on our caching tour through Ireland. TFTC GudrunXY

2010-05-23T19:00:00Z : Found it by Nachtwolf
Hello. After our boating holydays on the beautiful River Shannon we spent a few days in Dublin.
I explored this interesting lively city on foot and visited some caches. I had no problems to discover the sculpture, to fulfil the tasks and to find the cache.
Attention: The log-book is wet!!!
Thank you for this very nice cache and greetings from Germany Nachtwolf

2009-12-29T20:00:00Z : Write note by Kersti.com
While the cache is still in place, the recent bad weather has certainly taken it's toll. I'm currently away so can't get to it for the next couple of weeks but will sort it out as soon as possible.

groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:name: Roped In
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:long_description:
Background:
"The Linesman" is a life-like bronze of a docks worker, it reminds us that this area used to be a busy shipping area. Nearby is a memorial to Matt Talbot the temperance campaigner and another to merchant seamen who lost their lives during the "Emergency".

The Cache:
At the coordinates given is a feature. You need to find a few numbers in order to discover the location of the cache.

What day in the month was this feature unveiled? Call this AB.

How many letters are in the surname of the person who unveiled it? Call this C.

How many buttons are on the shirt? Call this D.

How many horizontal railing surround the feature? Call this E.

The first digit of the year it was unveiled is F.

Now to find the final location, solve below with each square bracket denoting one digit:

N 53° [F][Bx8].[F^E][C-A-(DxF)][Bx5]
W 006° [A][C-D].[C+A][D+F+E][Ax3+B]

Additional Waypoints

HIDDEN: FL19CG0 - Final location
N/S __ ° __ . ___ W/E ___ ° __ . ___
About 400 meters south east of starting point
groundspeak:cache.groundspeak:encoded_hints: Behind the stone, at ground level.

Very hard work to find the box, because it had fallen on the ground. But we made it ;)
Very interesting sculpture!
TFTC and kind regards from Austria, eve
A quick find with eve1987 on our caching tour through Ireland. TFTC GudrunXY

Hello. After our boating holydays on the beautiful River Shannon we spent a few days in Dublin.
I explored this interesting lively city on foot and visited some caches. I had no problems to discover the sculpture, to fulfil the tasks and to find the cache.
Attention: The log-book is wet!!!
Thank you for this very nice cache and greetings from Germany Nachtwolf
While the cache is still in place, the recent bad weather has certainly taken it's toll. I'm currently away so can't get to it for the next couple of weeks but will sort it out as soon as possible.
